docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration announced today that it would require a warning label on aerosol containers using fluorocarbon propellants as a first step toward eventual elimination of virtually all such products.

headline.main: F.D.A. to Require Warning Label For Fluorocarbon in Aerosol Cans

docs.abstract: FDA to require warning label on aerosol containers using fluorocarbon propellants as 1st step toward eventual elimination of such products; ruling becomes effective after Oct 31; Consumer Product Safety Comm to propose similar action for products it regulates; FDA Comr Donald Kennedy comments (M)
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration announced today that it would require a warning label on aerosol containers using fluorocarbon propellants as a first step toward eventual elimination of virtually all such products.

docs.lead_paragraph: Later,when she was well again, Judith could point to nothing special in her life, no marvelous happening that might have triggered the bizarre euphoria. The only "event" she could connect it to was having received that letter from a friend in California, Frank.

headline.main: FROM JOY TO DEPRESSION; New Insights Into the Chemistry of Moods

docs.abstract: Maggie Scarf article on recent research into mood disorders; evidence suggests that particular class of substances, called biogenic amines, are central to mood regulation and maintenance; 2 compounds most implicated in states of mood are serotonin and norepinephrine; balance between 2 at nerve-cell synapses may be most decisive in maintenance of normal mood states; Drs Gerald L Klerman, Peter Whybrow, Seymour Kety and Joseph L Schildkraut comment; early research of Drs Ronald Kuhn and Julius Axelrod recalled; illus (L)
docs.snippet: Later,when she was well again, Judith could point to nothing special in her life, no marvelous happening that might have triggered the bizarre euphoria. The only "event" she could connect it to  was having received that letter from a friend in...

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 21 The Health Research Group sought today to force the Food and Drug Administration to ban from the market a drug that the agency acknowledges to be dangerous and possiably responsible for 93 deaths.

headline.main: F.D.A. Is Urged to Ban Drug for Diabetics

docs.abstract: Health Research Group urges FDA to ban drug for diabetics that agency acknowledges is dangerous and possibly responsible for 93 deaths; drug, phenoformin, is sold under trade names DBI and Meltrol; health group dir Dr Sidney M Wolfe, in lr to HEW Sec Joseph Califano, contends there is evidence that drug is dangerous; Ciba-Geigy Pharmaceutical Co spokesman comments (S)
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 21 The Health Research Group sought today to force the Food and Drug Administration to ban from the market a drug that the agency acknowledges to be dangerous and possiably responsible for 93 deaths.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times
